summary: This is a superseding indictment filed in the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell. It charges her with multiple counts related to the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls, including conspiracy to entice minors to travel for illegal sex acts, enticement, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking conspiracy, in association with Jeffrey Epstein from approximately 1994 to 2004. This is a superseding indictment filed in the Southern District of New York against Ghislaine Maxwell, detailing charges of conspiracy to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts, sex trafficking of a minor, and perjury. It includes specific allegations regarding the recruitment and exploitation of 'Minor Victim-4' between 2001 and 2004, and cites false statements Maxwell made during a 2016 deposition.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to recruit, groom, and facilitate the sexual abuse of multiple minor girls, and with lying under oath in 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The primary perpetrator of sexual abuse against minor girls, with whom Maxwell conspired to entice, groom, and transport victims across state lines.

persons.name: Minor Victim-4
persons.context: A minor recruited by Epstein and Maxwell between 2001-2004 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, and who was also encouraged to recruit other girls.

persons.name: Minor Victim-2
persons.context: Referenced in the perjury count; Maxwell denied giving her a massage during her 2016 deposition testimony.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The United States Attorney who signed and filed the superseding indictment.

connections.description: Maxwell and Epstein conspired to entice, groom, and transport minor girls for the purpose of sexual abuse. Maxwell was Epstein's close associate, intimate partner (1994-1997), and property manager.
Maxwell was paid by Epstein to manage his various properties between approximately 1994 and 2004.
Maxwell is charged with recruiting, enticing, and obtaining Minor Victim-4 for commercial sex acts with Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein engaged in commercial sex acts with Minor Victim-4, a minor, and paid her hundreds of dollars per encounter.
Implied connection through the perjury charge where Maxwell denied giving her a massage, suggesting prior interaction.

events.title: Conspiracy to Abuse Minors
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein conspired to recruit, groom, and sexually abuse multiple minor girls, some as young as 14, at various properties.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-1
events.description: Maxwell groomed and participated in group sexual encounters with Minor Victim-1 (age ~14) and Epstein in New York and Florida, and enticed the victim to travel across state lines.

events.title: Grooming of Minor Victim-2 in New Mexico
events.description: Maxwell provided an unsolicited topless massage to Minor Victim-2 and encouraged her to massage Epstein at his New Mexico ranch.

events.title: Abuse of Minor Victim-3 in London
events.description: Maxwell groomed Minor Victim-3 in London, introduced her to Epstein, and encouraged her to provide massages during which Epstein sexually abused her.

events.title: Sex Trafficking of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Maxwell met, groomed, and facilitated the paid sexual abuse of Minor Victim-4 (age ~14) at Epstein's Palm Beach residence, and encouraged the victim to recruit other girls.

events.title: False Deposition Testimony
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell repeatedly provided false and perjurious statements under oath during a civil deposition regarding her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse of minors.

events.title: Recruitment and Abuse of Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein and Maxwell recruited Minor Victim-4 to engage in sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach residence, paid her cash, and encouraged her to recruit other girls.

events.title: Gift Sent to Minor Victim-4
events.description: Epstein caused a package (including lingerie) to be sent via Federal Express from Manhattan to Minor Victim-4's residence in Florida.

events.title: Appointment Scheduling for Minor Victim-4
events.description: An employee of Epstein's called Minor Victim-4 to schedule a massage appointment with Epstein.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition (First)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave sworn deposition testimony in a civil case (15 Civ. 7433), during which she denied knowledge of Epstein's scheme to recruit underage girls and claimed she was not aware of interacting with anyone under 18 other than the plaintiff.

events.title: Maxwell's Deposition (Second)
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell gave further sworn deposition testimony, falsely denying awareness of sex toys at Epstein's Palm Beach house, knowledge of Epstein having sexual activities with others, and ever giving anyone (including Epstein and Minor Victim-2) a massage.

locations: Upper East Side, Manhattan, New York (Epstein's New York Residence)
Palm Beach, Florida (Epstein's Palm Beach Residence)
Santa Fe, New Mexico (Epstein's New Mexico Residence)
Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for the indictment)
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell is charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to sexually exploit and abuse multiple minor girls, some as young as 14, from approximately 1994 to 2004.

The indictment details Maxwell's specific grooming methods: befriending victims, normalizing sexual conduct, being present during abuse, and arranging travel for victims to Epstein's properties in New York, Florida, New Mexico, and London.
Maxwell is accused of participating in group sexual encounters with Epstein and at least one minor victim (Minor Victim-1).
The charges include creating a network where victims were paid to recruit other underage girls for Epstein to abuse, constituting sex trafficking conspiracy from 2001-2004.
Maxwell allegedly lied under oath during a 2016 civil deposition about her role in facilitating Epstein's abuse.
The indictment charges Ghislaine Maxwell with conspiracy, sex trafficking of a minor (Minor Victim-4), and multiple counts of perjury for false statements made under oath in 2016.
Specific allegations detail that between 2001-2004, Maxwell and Epstein recruited Minor Victim-4, a minor who truthfully told them her age, for paid sex acts with Epstein at his Palm Beach home.
The indictment alleges Maxwell and Epstein encouraged Minor Victim-4 to recruit other girls for the same purpose.

The perjury charges are based on Maxwell's 2016 deposition denials of knowing about Epstein's scheme with underage girls, being aware of sex toys at his home, and having given massages to Epstein or victims.
The document includes forfeiture allegations seeking any property used to facilitate or derived from proceeds of the sex trafficking offense.
